description: During a late maintenance session, Lenart Kova receives an alert about a queued BCI mass update. After consulting with trusted colleagues, he decides to authorize the full release of all historical BCI data, believing the city must confront its history openly.

Residents awaken to abrupt changes in their BCI scores. Decades-old infractions and past personal actions are merged into current records, resulting in sudden job losses, service restrictions, and widespread confusion across Stenograd.

Large crowds gather at government buildings and city squares, demanding explanations and public accountability from the Council regarding the release of sensitive BCI history and individual records manipulation.

Council members, including Rada, Daria, and Oksana, are required to confront evidence of their past actions in a live public inquiry broadcast, facing accusations about their roles in BCI oversight and data manipulation.

After over a week of demonstrations and heated debate about justice and forgiveness, the Council disables the BCI scoring system 'until further notice' and launches a citywide forum on the right to be forgotten.
